Package framework.components

Class JSContainer

java.lang.Object
framework.components.JSContainer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CardLayout, CardLayoutItem, ExternalJavascript, ExternalStylesheet, HTMLTemplateContainer, JSButton, JSForm, JSInput, JSOption, JSSelect, JSTextArea, Table, TableBody, TableColumn, TableHead
public class JSContainer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Renderable
Most basic component built in with a default Renderer
An instance of this component will render a simple tag in the browser. The tag is specified in the constructor of the component or can be set via setTag(String)
Example:
var ctn = new framework.components.JSContainer('mycomponent', 'div');

ctn.setStyle('width', '100px')
   .setStyle('height', '100px')
   .setStyle('background', 'red');

ctn.on('click', function(e){
   alert('Hello world');
})
source.addChild(ctn);

 All other components in the framework are sub classes of this component
Author:
Rossaye Abdool Kureem Apr 10, 2018

    • hasClass

      public boolean hasClass​(java.lang.String cls)
      Description copied from interface: Renderable
      Checks if the specified style class is present on this component.
      Can only check single class. Will throw an error if trying to check multiple classes at once
      E.g.
      Correct:
      r.hasClass("myclass")

      Error:
      r.hasClass("myclass1 myclass2")
      Specified by:
      hasClass in interface Renderable
      Parameters:
      cls - The class to check if present
      Returns:
      Whether the specified styleclass is present or not

    • toggleClass

      public Renderable toggleClass​(java.lang.String cls)
      Description copied from interface: Renderable
      Will toggle the specified class on the component. i.e. If the specified styleclass is present, it will remove it, and if it is not present, it will add it
      Note that this method internally uses Renderable.hasClass(String) to check if styleclass is present. This means that is works only on single class. Cannot toggle multiple classes at once.
      Specified by:
      toggleClass in interface Renderable
      Parameters:
      cls - The style class
      Returns:
      The update state of the current component

    • removeClass

      public jsweet.dom.HTMLElement getElement()
      Description copied from interface: Renderable
